quote: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: When the rich wage war it's the poor who die.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: If you are lonely when you are alone, you are in bad company.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Commitment is an act, not a word.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: I have no need for good souls: an accomplice is what I wanted.
author: Jean Paul Satre

quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: People understand me so poorly that they don't even understand my complaint about them not understanding me.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: The most common form of despair is not being who you are.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations — one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it — you will regret both.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: The most painful state of being is remembering the future, particularly the one you'll never have.
author: Søren Kierkegaard
